alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 12:24PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Forsyth, northeastern Davidson and northwestern Guilford Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kernersville, or near Winston-Salem, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, and localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall could cause minor flooding. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, High Point, Kernersville, Summerfield, Stokesdale, Walkertown, Sedge Garden, Colfax and Oak Hollow Marina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
